I am running into an error while running a TD scenario using axis2 1.2 runtime (error message included below).  There might also be an issue with the loading of the axis2 runtime via preferences, because even if I switch back to axis2 1.1.1 the problem remains even though this combination worked previously.

Lahiru, just to clarify Andrew's point about testing with Axis2 1.1.1.  If he just set Axis2 runtime to point to Axis2 1.1.1, then the Axis2 Web services scenarios works.  However, once he set the Axis2 runtime to point to Axis2 1.2, then it does not work.  At that point, Axis2 Web services scenario fails even after setting back to Axis2 1.1.1.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Lahiru, just to clarify Andrew's point about testing with Axis2 1.1.1.  If he
> just set Axis2 runtime to point to Axis2 1.1.1, then the Axis2 Web services
> scenarios works.  However, once he set the Axis2 runtime to point to Axis2 1.2,
> then it does not work.  At that point, Axis2 Web services scenario fails even
> after setting back to Axis2 1.1.1.

Chris, I was able reproduce the scenario described aboveand look at what has happened in the Axis2 1.1.1 and Axis2 1.2. I am afraid that this cause by due to  there has been an API change in the two set of artifacts that we refer above regarding org.apache.axis2.wsdl.codegen.CodeGenConfiguration. 

This can be fixed in short time. But needed to clarify how we approach on the different version of the target runtime. 

As for now we only ask the user to point to an existing axis2 distribution regardless of the version. I think it would be time to introduce the version verification also into consideration. 

I see two ways

1) verify the version of the axis2 distribution (maybe md5 digest value compare ) here than we have to strict to the archived distributions

2) ask user to enter the version ..

Provided that we have the version of the Axis2 distribution then the plugins will be able to cater the issue here. 

Also to get rid of the issue changing back to an old version (Axis2 1.1.1 then Axis2 1.2 and again to Axis2 1.1.1) I can trigger a class loader cleanup every time a different version is set at the preferences from current version. I have a performance improvement code there, if the target runtime is already loaded the class loader do not load that again. 

I am gray in thinking that its possible to pre assume that any runtime will be always API consistent. Even in the tomcat case the user is the person who points the correct version AFAIK.  

Kathy please add your thoughts also ...

Thanks 

Lahiru.

I just have a chat with Chris, our thoughts are unless you could easily detect Axis2 1.1.1 and 1.2 (without exposing it as a UI change), we should just support Axis2 1.2 and make sure the page and doc says so.  The rationale is Axis2 1.2 will be the latest release of Axis2 when WTP 2.0 releases in June 2007.

We have an enhancement bug 173528 for properly designing the extensibility points to support multiple versions of Axis2.  We could address that in WTP 3.0.

Created an attachment (id=65803)
fix for the bug 184729

Update the TD scenario to work with the Axis2 1.2

Please review and commit

Thanks 

Lahiru
